notes.noteContent: Effective Date: 11/21/2025 18:01Type: RNAO - Post Fall Assessment Section B Post Fall Assessment : Fall was not witnessed. Date and time the Resident fell or was found: 11/21/2025 6:02 PMDate and time of notification: 11/21/2025Name of SDM/POA contacted. Steven Unwitnessed report: Room mate of the resident rang the bell to notify staffs that resident fell.Resident's description of the fall: nonePhysical exam conducted. Resident does not have any fall-related injury/injuries or verbal/non-verbal indicators of pain. Resident does not show signs of new pain after fall. It is unknown ifResident hit their head. Resident did not experience a change in their usual level of mobility. Vitals : T 36.3 - 11/21/2025 18:05 Route: Forehead (non-contact)BP 101/63 - 11/21/2025 16:54 Position: Sitting r/armP 77 - 11/21/2025 16:54 Pulse Type: UTD - Unable to DetermineR 18.0 - 11/21/2025 16:54O2 98.0 % - 11/21/2025 16:54 Method: Room AirNo significant change in blood pressure. No significant change in pulse. No significant change in respirations. No significant change in oxygen saturation. Section C: Assessment of Causal and Contributing Factors : Most recent fall occured at a LTC home. Activity during most recent fall: Unknown. Resident experiences impaired mobility. Resident has bladder incontinence. Resident is of advanced age (85+ years). Resident has bowel incontinence. Resident has a cognitive impairment. Polypharmacy (5+ meds daily) noted. Resident had a previous fall in the past year. Resident has no bleeding risk. Skin integrity risk: Yes. Resident has fragile skin. Shearing forces noted. Fracture risk: Yes. Attendees at the huddle:PSW Drew, Ven, AninaSynopsis of the discussion: closely monitoring, make sure alarm is on, call bell in reachAction Items and Follow Up: monitoringResident has not had 2 or more falls in the past 30 days. notes.noteType: Nursing Post Fall/Incident Follow up (Head Injury Check)
notes.noteContent: Data : Writer received phone call at approx 1900 related to resident falling outside on ramp entering the building. Resident was laying on right side. No resident outside or staff could confirm if resident hit his head. Resident stated that he did not hit his head but was unsure. No evidence of clutter on the ground. Resident does have unsteady gait and more then likely lead to the fall. Weather condition were also wet. Action : Resident got himself up from the ground using the railing. Resident assisted inside by writer and staff. Resident sat in chair for approx 5 mins, range of motion checked and no concerns noted at time of assessment. Resident did have small scuff on right hand. Resident assisted back to floor and vitals taken and charted stable. No further concerns noted at time of assessment. Resident POA (brittany) notified and was happy for the update. Response : Resident remains in room at this time resting in bed with call bell at side. Writer and staff will continue to follow up with resident as needed on shift. Author:Noah Macdonald Nursing - Registered Nurse [e-SIGNED]Signature: ________________ Facility #: RNAO - Post Fall Assessment Time Range: All Author: All Department: All Resident Name :Collison, Harriette (922131005485)Location :2 209 AAdmission Date : 10/27/2022 Medical Record # :6929 685 136HBGender :FDate of Birth :01/13/1948 Physician :Ng, Albert PatrickPharmacy :MediSystem London IMM Allergies :Penicillin Diagnoses :Hyperlipidaemia, unspecified(E78.5), Disorders of initiating and maintaining sleep [insomnias](G47.0), Alzheimer's disease, unspecified (G30.9), Type 2 diabetes mellitus without (mention of) complications(E11.9), Benign hypertension(I10.0), Gout, unspecified, unspecified site (M10.99), Dysphasia and aphasia(R47.0), Other specified disorders of bladder(N32.8), Bipolar affective disorder, unspecified(F31.9), Anxiety disorder, unspecified(F41.9), Other synovitis and tenosynovitis, shoulder region(M65.81), Other bursitis, not elsewhere classified, shoulder region(M71.51), Other and unspecified injury of muscle(s) and tendon(s) of the rotator cuff of shoulder(S46.08)

notes.noteContent: Data : when the writer was with another resident and heard the sound like "help me,please help me" the writer and the psw on the floor L. opened the door and found that the resident was sitting with bump on the floor and his head was resting in the bed and lower part of the body is on the floor and both the knee extended towards the door,resident said that when he tried to stand up he fell on the floor and didn't hit his head.but the fall was unwitnessed.
